p: Processing is well-known to enhance the flavor of pulses [ 18]. In the current study, the impact of processing on the elimination of off-flavor bioactive substances is suggested. Some isoflavones, phenolic compounds, oxidized phosphatidylcholine, and lipoxygenase activity have been reported to be bioactive substances responsible for the off-flavors of chickpea [ 18]. The incorporation of processed chickpea flour at 50% enhanced the taste and overall acceptability of the mankoushe significantly. The sensory enhancement seen in this study could also be attributed to Maillard reactions [ 38]. It has been reported that under controlled conditions of temperature, time, water activity, and pH, the Maillard reactions could lead to improvement of flavor, aroma, texture, and color of the food product [ 39].
